sub_title: Localization professional • Passionate about UX • EMEIA GEO Manager @ Women in Localization
summary:
I am passionate about genuine connections, fellow humans and constant new opportunities for learning and growth (on both a personal and professional level). Continually expanding my knowledge in the newest Localization and UX trends, keeping up to date through reading, exchange and active involvement in Localization events is part of my routine. 

I am multilingual (I speak German and French on a near-native level having pursued all my education in German teaching schools and having lived and studied in France for a few years), well-travelled and I get a lot of energy from people with diverse backgrounds and linguistic and cultural heritage.

   ✨✨✨ My vision is to shift the narrative from Localization to International UX by putting people's needs and cultural identity at the heart of every endeavour.

Becoming a core member of Women in Localization has allowed me to get even closer to the Localization Community.

    ✨✨✨ I am a strong believer that great value comes from bringing people and ideas together. We are not meant to be solo travellers, we can achieve greatness only by joining forces.

Travel is an amazing opportunity to experience new cultures and explore inspiring natural environments and I try to travel as much as possible to broaden my knowledge and horizons. I enjoy reading, listening to music, my daily yoga practice, my cats and all the beauty that surrounds us.

Language Services, Sales, Product, Marketing - and all products. 

• At KUDO I built on the previous learnings and experiences and worked towards creating an Agile Localization Program across multiple and diverse markets and languages (EMEA, North America, APAC, Latam). 

• Successfully led an RFP project to partner with an LSP as KUDO was shifting from a freelancer model to an agency one. 

• I have put in place and driven different initiatives to grow KUDO's global presence and support a consistent and impactful brand presence: UX Writing guidelines, Localization Style Guides (15 languages), Internationalization guidelines, Glossaries, Language Quality Program, multilingual SEO strategy, creative and market research initiatives. 

• Recruited KUDO’s first UX Writer - the new colleague had a direct line of report to me. This significantly strengthened and improved the collaboration between Product Management, Design and Localization.

• Advocated for and ensured that Localization gets a seat at the Product Development table. This has significantly streamlined the localization processes, reduced time to market and established Localization as one of the main drivers of the company's success on the international landscape. 

• Proactively drove the creation of a UX Research initiative revolving around getting a better understanding of our international audience with the ultimate goal of ensuring a culturally appropriate and strong product-market fit. My vision is to shift the narrative from Localization to International UX by putting our customers’ needs and cultural identity at the heart of the company", 'title': 'Localization @KUDO', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 3320903, 'name': 'BUX', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEfkM3U7mqBWQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1617702364322?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=kOIuuWXb0M40ljS2VRMdwFak5O6txylNMuq5eUYVqQU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/bux/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'BUX', 'description': "One-woman Localization band: I have single-handedly developed, and owned the BUX Localization Program (delivering top-notch Localization for two products across 9 markets). 

• Streamlined the Localization processes, transitioning from an afterthought approach to an Agile Localization strategy, within just a few months. 

• Created the BUX Localization Kit (Localization Style Guide, Terminology, Translators/Editors Guidelines, UX Writing guidelines). This has become the main tool in ensuring a consistent and impactful presence of the BUX brand in 9 markets. 

• I have recruited and onboarded a team of 9 freelance language and culture specialists to help us grow our Localization initiatives and execute on our strategy. The team had a direct line of report to me. 

• Supported the Head of Product with the recruitment of the company's first UX Writer - the new colleague had a direct line of report to me. This significantly strengthened and improved the collaboration between Product Management, Design and Localization. 

• Advocated for and ensured that Localization gets a seat at the Product Development table. This has significantly streamlined the localization processes, reduced time to market and has established Localization as one of the main drivers of the company's success on the international landscape.
